The pairs (p,q) such that the Hodge number h^{pq} of \operatorname {H}^n(X) are non-zero satisfy the following conditions:
(p,q)\in [0,n]\times [0,n].
If \dim X=N, and n\geqslant N, then (p,q)\in [n-N,N]\times [n-N,N].
If X is proper, then p+q\leqslant n.
If X is smooth, then p+q\geqslant n. The same conclusion holds if X is an equidimensional "rational homology manifold" of dimension N, i.e. if, for all x\in X, \operatorname {H}^i_{(x)}(X,\mathbb {Q}) = \begin {cases} 0 &\text {if }i\neq 2N \\\mathbb {Q} &\text {if }i=2N. \end {cases}
